text: Xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx via Beer Buddy for iPhone

bottle in trade. much better than the non barrel aged. this was sweet but still balanced. aroma is chocolate and strawberry. not much barrel in aroma or taste but the sweetness works really well. enjoyed!

6.1% 2016 version... Black pour with a thin beige head and very light carbonation ..... aroma of strawberry, chocolate, roasted malts and vanilla ..... taste is of Strawberry, oak, chocolate, vanilla, bourbon, roasted malts, sugar and lactose along with .... finish is of bourbon, dry oak and spice along with a bit of sugar and vanilla ..... body is on thinner side .... nice solid sessionable sweet stout

2016 bottle. Dark beer with some mahogany hues around the edges. Thin grayish beige head that shrank to a small slick. Subtle wood, strawberry and chocolate nose. This has the smooth lactic sense in the base beer, with strawberry fruitiness, milk chocolate, vanilla and an added extra wet oak flavor. Understated use of a barrel in this one. It mostly comes out in an alcohol evaporation in the finish.

Pours a dark brown with a creamy khaki head. Strawberry and vanilla ice cream nose. Chocolate flavor is prominent. Strawberry flavor comes through secondarily and is akin to frankenberry cereal. Creamy mouthfeel with a hint of carbonation.

Bottle. Poured a black color with an average frothy tan head that mostly lasted with very good lacing. Moderate to heavy chocolate, sweet fruit, wood and vanilla aroma. Medium to heavy milk chocolate flavor with a medium to heavy sweet finish of moderate duration. Full body with a smooth texture and flat carbonation. This is a solid sweet beer.

12 oz. bottle from Cappys-Norwood. Pours a dark coffee brown, not quite opaque, with a small tan head that settles into a good sized lasting ring. Notes of vanilla, cocoa, brown sugar, bourbon, earth, faint charred oak, and dark fruit, which I guess is the strawberry. Light-medium bodied, with a smooth, sweet mouthfeel and modest carbonation. Flavors come together as it warms. The first few sips arent as rewarding but after a few minutes its not bad at all.

Picked up a single 12-oz bottle at Heritage Liquors in Maplewood, Minnesota. Pours. an opaque reddish brown colored brew with a decent sized beige head that slowly dissipates and leave behind some excellent lacing. Aroma of strawberry, chocolate and vanilla profile. Taste is full bodied, with dark chocolate, a hint of lactose, vanilla and some mild strawberries. Finish has a more vanilla and strawberry aftertaste with a hint of bourbon followed by a mild tart berry secondary aftertaste. A nice treatment to their regular Neapolitan Milk Stout.

Got a pint at a pub - or a spots bar - in Holland, Michigan. Underestimated the name and never thought about the "Neapolitan". Almost blown away by the berriness on the flavour. Absolutely amazing. Perfectly creamy, chocolate and strawberry as the name indicates. The aroma is just a bit sour, perhaps because the pint is served too cold. Wonderful beer.

12oz bottle 11/28/16 (Binnys Plainfield)-42° in Shaker-Pours black with a small ring for a head. A faint aroma of whisky. Taste of strawberry, vanilla, whisky, and chocolate. This medium bodied brew has everything going for it. Amazing. Nice job.
Very decent. Hints of vanilla chocolate and berry. Full dark body, sweet finish.
This is really quite something. Pours a very dark brown. Tastes exactly like neopolitan ice cream. Love it
Bottle share on RBSG bus In the tasting glass black with a tan head. Nose of chocolate and vanilla. Full body. Flavor is rich chocolate, vanilla, and strawberry. Finishes kind of sweet. Really good.
12 ounce bottle. Dark pour with creamy head. Milk lactose. Chocolate. Some strawberry. Nice.

Bottle. It poured a dark brown color with a tan head. The aroma was of dark chocolate, strawberry and vanilla. The taste was similar to the aroma with more chocolate, vanilla, strawberry and a hint of wood. Very good.

Bottle thanks to Steve. Pours out dark brown almost black topped with a small head. Nose is big sweet notes chocolate vanilla berries and some roast. Taste is more of the heavy sweetness vanilla berries chocolate and a nice barrel presents.
2015 bottle. Pours brown. Aroma is berries, vanilla, chocolate, faint oak, and some lactose. Flavor is chocolate, vanilla, booze, faint oak, roasty bitterness, and faint berries. Medium body.
Sample at RBSG PGH 2016. Clear dark brown color, tan head. Aroma has vanilla, chocolate, toasted coconut, mixed berries. Taste is sweet fruity milk chocolate, vanilla, whiskey. Very tasty.

From a bottle. Pours with a very thick, frothy tan head. Tastes like chocolate malt, booze, strawberry ice cream, vanilla, and woody. Medium body and low carbonation. Smells like chocolate malt, booze, strawberry, vanilla, and wood.

reddish brown. Smells like strawberries and vanilla. Loads of strawberry in flavor. Tastes like fake additives which only enforced the awesomeness of the beer. Sweet. Malty. Even some chocolate in the finish

Bottle shared at RBSG. The beer is a dark brown with a beige head of foam. The aroma has sweet chocolate, moderate strawberries, and sweet vanilla. The barrel is more of a background note. Sweet throughout. Bigger body with moderate carbonation.
Bus share, RBSG 2016. Bottle. Very dark brown. Chocolate covered strawberries with prominent (but balanced) barrel traits. Moderately bitter, lightly boozy. I liked it better than the original.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Sampled at rbsg. Dark brown. Beige head. Bourbon barrel aroma. Sweet flavor. Brown sugar. Bourbon and wood. Berries, earth, chocolate. Tasty stuff.
Bottle on RBSG Bus. Pours a very dark brown with small beige head. The aroma is strong chocolate, strawberry cream, bourbon. Thick, chewy, roast, bourbon, strawberry, vanilla cream, very nice.
Bottle - Dark sweet bourbon, vanilla, chocolate and coconut. Clear dark brown with a light brown head. Dark cocoa, chocolate and strawberry with bourbon. Different than the oroginal and nice.
Does its name justice but it is quite sickly. You couldnt drink it all night but its a nice one off.

12 ounce bottle, packaged on date printed on label says 04/14/16, 6.1% ABV. Served in a snifter, the beer pours dark brown/black with about an inch tan head. Head retention and lacing are both decent enough. The brew smells like neapolitan ice cream (chocolate, strawberry, vanilla), along with some nuttiness. Dont pick up any barrel character in the aroma at all. Taste is similar to the aroma, but there is some whiskey and vanilla noticeable in the taste, but it isnt very strong. I cant imagine this spent too much time in a barrel. But with that being said, I do like the taste of this brew (I did like the regular neapolitan milk stout). Mouthfeel/body is medium/full, its creamy and coating with moderate carbonation. Im glad I got to try this and I thought it was good, but I am disappointed there wasnt more barrel character noticeable in the taste or aroma, and what barrel was there just seemed very subtle to me. $5.99 a bottle.

12oz bottle from Kenny Road Market: deep black-brown pour thin tan head. aroma of strawberry, background chocolate. tastes are cocoa, vanilla, berry. bourbon knocks down the sweetness. thin slick palate.
Bottle. Pours black with head explosion. Afraid its infected. Aroma is sweet bourbon. Taste isnt really anything like the non barrel aged version. I think i got a bad bottle.

12oz bottle from bananabi11, cellared a few weeks and shared with him at cellar temperature. Brownish black pour with a brown head. Aroma has sweet vanilla, choco/caramel and berries. Taste is of sweet choco/caramel, vanilla, milk and berries. Squinting, strawberries. Medium to full bodied, lowly carbonated, the blend is very well done and there is a bit of an alcohol presence. Finishes sweetly. This is quite sweet, but not over the top, and this is extremely tasty. Excellent example of the style. 14.7
UPDATED: MAY 20, 2016 Bottle - pours dark brown tan head - nose/taste of strawberry ice cream, cocoa, milk sugar and vanilla - med body
Bottle. Dark brown pour with tan head. Sweet strawberry candy notes, vanilla and chocolate aromas. Flavors are candied strawberries, vanilla, chocolate ice cream notes.
On tap at Capones. Poured a dark brown color with a smaller sized off white head. Vanilla, chocolate, bourbon, with some strawberries.Interesting.

Beautiful dark black with thick dense quarter inch head. Smells like chocolate covered strawberries. Whoa, tastes like chocolate covered strawberries splashed with rich vanilla ice cream. Barrel is subtle at first then comes through as this warms up. Good idea keeping this out of Imperial range. Wonderful. Thanks HankDaStank for this gem.

Bottle. Looks like a stout, tastes like a milkshake made with the Neapolitan ice cream left over from my kid brothers birthday and whiskey borrowed from my dads liquor cabinet. Loved the base beer and love this one too. PS: Fuck Hairball and That School Up North.
12-oz bottle from binnys Lakeview. sweet malty nose, good head that lasted, strawberry (and chocolate and vanilla) ice cream with a splash of booze.

12 oz bottle. The beer is black, wall to wall. Huge brown head that puffs up quickly. Lots of lacing. The aroma is full of vanilla and milk chocolate. Sweet undertone of strawberry. Very ice creamy flavor. Surprisingly nice. The combination works well. Lots of lactose flavor, but with the vanilla and strawberry, I kinda like it. Taste is fairly sweet. Lots of vanilla and chocolate milk with some strawberry in the finish. Its nice that the strawberry is mild because that flavor could take over quickly. Full body. Lots of creamy carbonation. Solid beer.

330ml bottle. Dark brown body with a thick, dark, and finely-bubbled mocha head. The aroma is sugary-sweet, with the reminiscence of a synthetic strawberry milkshake. The flavour is similarly of strawberry milkshake, undercut by cream and roasted malts. Faint vanilla notes drift through the aftertaste.

Bottle poured into a snifter..opaque with a thin tan head..aroma of chocolate,bourbon,malted milk,coffee..
Tastes of chocolate,bourbon,vanilla,malted milk..not
boozy ..not bad.

Bottle... This beer rocks! Pours dark brown with a small, fizzy, taupe head. The aroma is a decadent swirl of chocolate crème, toffee, vanilla and sweet fruitiness. Full-bodied with modest carbonation. The flavor is rich and bittersweet, featuring notes of sugary strawberries, chocolate crème, bourbon and toasted oak. Deeply roasted, sugary finish. World-class beer. A joy to drink!
Bottle. Pours dark with brown rings. Aroma is sweet chocolate and strawberry. Taste is excellent in small doses. Barrel aged strawberry. Couldnt drink a pint but 4oz was awesome.

Bottle thanks to Deyholla! Deep town with a creamy tan head. Nose is
Quite pleasant. Nice strawberry, mellow vanilla and chocolate syrup. Cery reminiscent of chocolate dipped strawberries. Strawberry really shines through in the flavor. Slightly medicinal. Boozy heat. Grows a bit sticky and cloying. Great in small doses.

Bottle. Pours black with a brown head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has a combination of strawberry and oak with sweet dark grains and a bit of roasted malts supporting. Flavor has lots of strawberry with some sweet dark grains, vanilla a bit of barrel and a light roasted malt note.
On tap at FOBAB 2015. Drunken notes written in program note lactose sweet malty bourbon choc. Is what it says it is.
Tap. Black with small head. Light bourbon with quite a bit of sweet strawberry. Underlying chocolate. Dont catch much vanilla. Excellent.
12oz bottle. Obligatory deep brown color/low head. Nicely barrel-aged notes atop the melted strawberry/vanilla/chocolate ice cream & roasty beer flavors! Full body and medium+ carbonation.

On tap. Pours black with almost no head. Aromas of sweet dark chocolate and vanilla. As advertised, flavours of chocolate, vanilla and strawberry. Quite sweet but nicely balanced to the roasted malts.
Thanks Gary for the split. Overall just what I was looking for. Not a ton of barrel but does balance the sweetness. Big strawberry. Good stuff.
Black with tan head. Creamy vanilla and berry flavor. Not getting much barrel aged off it. Strawberry happiness. Had a 2oz pour of this at FOBAB 2015.

Bottle. The pout is ball with a creamy dark head. The nose is little to no bourbon, and a lot of vanilla and strawberry. The taste is mostly neapolitan with a smoothness of bourbon ever so faint. I wish the bourbon came out more, but in all honestly this is a good, full, thick, flavorful stout. Well done.

12 ounce bottle into snifter, 2015 vintage bottling. Pours nearly pitch black color with a 1 finger dense tan head with good retention, that reduces to a thin lace cap that lingers. Light spotty lacing clings around the glass, with a fair amount of streaming carbonation retaining the cap. Aromas of big strawberry, vanilla, cream, milk chocolate, cocoa, toffee, toasted oak, light-moderate bourbon, and oak/roasted earthiness. Fantastic aromas with awesome balance and complexity of dark/roasted malt, strawberry/vanilla, and bourbon barrel notes; with great strength. Smells identical to ice cream. Taste of big strawberry, vanilla, cream, milk chocolate, cocoa, toffee, toasted oak, light-moderate bourbon, and oak/roasted earthiness. Light-moderate roasted bitterness and bourbon/oak spiciness on the finish; with lingering notes of strawberry, vanilla, cream, milk chocolate, cocoa, toffee, toasted oak, and roasted earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Fasntastic complexity, robustness, and balance of dark/roasted malt, strawberry/vanilla, and bourbon barrel flavors; with a great roasted bitterness/sweetness balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Light-medium carbonation and medium bodied; with a very smooth and moderately creamy/silky mouthfeel that is great. Alcohol is very well hidden with minimal warming present after the finish. Overall this is an incredible barrel aged stout stout! All around awesome complexity, robustness, and balance of dark/roasted malt, strawberry/vanilla, and bourbon barrel flavors; and very smooth and easy to sip on with the modest ABV. The bourbon character was lower than expected but still noticeable; and the barrel intensified the vanilla/cream notes making this taste identical to real ice cream across the board. A highly enjoyable offering.

Never had the neapolitan milk stout so no review in comparison here. Pours black. very thin head that quickly dissipates. I get the name. Aroma of berry, chocolate and vanilla. I can get a weak note of oak but its hugely lacking in the aroma of barrel aging that I would expect. Really tasty. Same thing, huge notes of chocolate, berry and vanilla. Faint oak. medium/full body. Really oily texture. Sweet finish. Really tasty but I cannot rate this higher because it is a barrel aged stout. Its truely lacking in the flavor you would expect from barrel aging but it is really tasty.
Dark brown pour with a slight tan head. Chocolate strawberry nose. Interesting. Booze, malty, chocolate and vanilla with some Berry hint (though the berry is artificial).

Bottle. Aroma is strong oak and vanilla, dusty cocoa and light berries. Tastes mildly sweet. Balance of bourbon, vanilla, cocoa, strawberry and some coconut. Medium body. Slightly creamy. Solid stout. Goes down easy.

Pour out of 12 oz bottle, dark black pour with tan head, aroma brought notes of nice chocolate, cocoa, bourbon, vanilla, into a bit of strawberry, coffee, some sweet dark fruit notes as well. Taste was a mix of dark chocolate, milk chocolate, hints of strawberry, berry, hints of vanilla, bourbon, finishing sweet. The flavors are balanced very well, tasty brew.

Ebony with a thick, foamy head that leaves thick, foamy lacing. Aroma and taste of dark chocolate and fruit, though not sure I would have thought strawberry. A bit of vanilla but it definitely plays third string.

UPDATED: OCT 29, 2015 From notes. On tap at Bellâs Funvitational on September 12. The pour is a dark brown to light black with a couple signs of head (light spots of film) and no lace. The aroma is definitely Neapolitan ice cream with a little barrel stave. There is a good dried vanilla and chocolate present, with a beautiful strawberry that is more dominant than the others. A light bourbon is present, but it really smells like Dippinâ Dots Neapolitan with a little bourbon barrel character added in. The flavor is good. Itâs a lot of dried strawberry ice cream with a hint of bourbon and a barrel influenced vanilla. Chocolate and a light roasted malt finish it up nicely. The aroma was definitely a lot better with this one. The mouth feel is thinner and a good carbonation helps it stick around when it doesnât seem like it should be memorable. Good dry ice cream finish.

Draft to mini-snifter. Looks solid; a slightly translucent very dark (almost black) cola with very light beige lacing. Smells solid too; oak, vanilla, and caramel alongside neopolitan ice cream with strawberry being the most prominent flavor. Tastes like it smells with a pleasant medium full-bodied mouthfeel. Good stuff.

UPDATED: OCT 29, 2015 Sample at Funvitational. Aroma is strawberry, wafer, vanilla , chocolate, barrel. Appearance is thin, dark brown, light brown head. Taste is neapolitan ice cream with barrel. Mouthfeel is wonderful, good carbonation, and pretty thick. Overall, I like it a bit.
Bottle shared by a friend. Dark brown pour with a medium tan head. Aroma of raspberry liqueur and vanilla. Creamy strawberry and vanilla flavor with a boozy chocolate finish.
Bottle. Pours brown. Aroma and taste are light ice cream with bourbon. I think the bourbon flavors takes a little away from how interesting this beer is.

Dark brown pour, brown head. I dont know how they did it. But somehow all the flavors creep around your tongue as you drink it. really a neat beer! No flavors are too pronounced and the barrel flavor is really nice. Vanilla, chooclate, berry, graham, bourbon. Nice!
Bottle. Dark brown pour with a kaki head. Strawberry bouquet. Caramels, artificial strawberry, and chocolate notes. Average body and mouthfeel.

Note, on tap at the brew pub, lots of bourbon and chocolate with a hints of vanilla and strawberry, great makes the beer seem a bit bolder, great

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
12oz wax dipped bottle pours a dark black with a thin khaki head. strawberry vanilla and chocolate with a slight bourbon taste.

Refrigerated 12 oz. brown bottle poured into a shaker. Black with small off-white head. Aroma is strawberry, medium body, creamy texture, medium/low carbonation, and some small bubble lacing. Taste is chocolate, vanilla, and medicinal strawberry, and some oak. The medicinal strawberry doesnt work for me.

Draft at FoBAB 14 from notes. Pours a hazy brown color with a medium sized beige head. The aroma and flavor have chocolate, strawberry, some vanilla sweetness, lactose sugar, at times seemed a bit chemical in nature, ok for a gimmick beer.
Bottle. Color is black thin head. Aroma of vanilla and chocolate. Taste is thin body lots of chocolate and slight berry oak.

12oz bottle - 2014 - pours dark brown with thin light tan head . Aromas of vanilla and strawberry . The strawberry flavor really shows through with a sweet bourbon finish . 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tap, aroma is tons of strawberry and chocolate there is only a little barrel on the aroma and taste but it seems to give it a more full flavor, great!

Tap: Deep, deep brown with a sliver of tan foam outlining the top. Huge strawberry ice cream aroma. Even more prominent than in the original Neapolitan. Smells like a berries & crème mélange with undertones of roasty cacao beans. Plenty of creamy & milky sweetness on the nose. Doesnt really smell barrel aged, though. Flavor comes out swinging similarly hard with strawberry up front followed by a semisweet drizzle of chocolate syrup. Vanilla is the lightest of the trifecta, but shows up lightly in the latter half of each sip. Cream, milk, & lactose sweetness are all apparent. It really does remind you of ice cream in a strange way. This is potentially more "full" or robust than the original version in body & boldness of flavor, but I still dont get any notable barrel notes. Good stuff.

Draft pour at FOBaB 2014 pours opaque cola brown. Nose very medicinal. Some sweet malt and light strawberry, but chemically. Taste lactose sweet, then tastes light salt water taffy. No bitterness. Sweeter finish again with artificial fruit flavor. Sounded like an interesting concept, but I didnt care for it.

On tap: The aroma consists of moderate-heavy strawberry, light vanilla, and a touch chocolate. Its a dark brown leather, virtually black, with no transparency and a small beige head that quickly fades to a thin ring around the edges of the glass. The flavor starts with moderate-heavy strawberry with light chocolate. The finish has light-moderate vanilla with barely a hint of coffee. Its medium-full bodied with soft carbonation and mouthfeel. Overall, the barrel aging influence is almost nonexistent. The strawberry seems to be stronger than the regular version, but there isnt much different.
Draft. Not bad for a novelty beer, tastes exactly like the ice cream, with a hit of bourbon. Dessert beer at its finest.

At fobab 2014. Listed as Neapolitan aged in oak bourbon barrels. All the flavors of the regular but The barrel really improves this one. Strawberry is there but the flavor is blended in better. Thicker and creamier than the regular.

Milky and coffe flavored. Really easy to drink and slightly sweet. Ours dark brown in color with a tan head. Smells chocolates. Ha this one at dry hoo 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
